uk.nhs.interoperability.capabilities

Interface AuditService

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ITKSimpleAudit

    public interface AuditService
    An representation of an ITK compliant* audit service that has the capability to audit ITK messaging related events In general the expected usage pattern is to audit on both the client and service provider sides of any ITK operation. Additionally the intent to do something should be audited - e.g. intention to send a message or call a service MESSAGE_SENT_EVENT. An additional audit call may then be required for the same logical action should any processing errors occur - e.g. connection timeouts MESSAGE_PROCESSING_FAILURE

    *TODO note further work is required to understand the audit requirements around the human actors (patient and carer) in the audit
    Since:
    version 0.1
    Author:
    Michael Odling-Smee, Nicholas Jones

    • Method Detail

      • auditEvent

        @Requirement(traceTo="IFA-SEC-02",
             status="abstract")
void auditEvent(String event,
                          long eventTime,
                          ITKMessageProperties itkMessageProperties)
                throws AuditException
        Writes an audit event to the audit service using the supplied information.
        Parameters:
        event - The string description of the event - e.g. MESSAGE_PROCESSING_FAILURE, MESSAGE_RECEIPT_EVENT, MESSAGE_SENT_EVENT
        eventTime - The time the event occurred (in unix time). Note depending on the implementation this may differ from the time at which the audit record is actually committed
        itkMessageProperties - The properties of the message to which this event pertains
        Throws:
        AuditException - If there are any issues accessing the underlying audit implementation (e.g. I/O exception) or if the event and/or itkMessageProperties is null
